body.name: Corsair K100 RGB Optical-Mechanical Wired Gaming Keyboard - OPX Switches - PBT Double-Shot Keycaps - Elgato Stream Deck and iCUE Compatible - QWERTY NA Layout - Black

deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 23 hrs 54 mins
features: The CORSAIR K100 RGB is the pinnacle of CORSAIR keyboards, offering the cutting-edge performance, style, durability, and customization that gamers need to stand above the rest..Keyboard Cable Material: Braided
The centerpiece of your gaming setup, the CORSAIR K100 RGB boasts a refined design bolstered by a durable aluminum frame, dynamic per-key RGB backlighting, and a 44-zone three-sided LightEdge.

Powered by CORSAIR AXON Hyper-Processing Technology, enabling CORSAIR’s most advanced gaming keyboard experience by delivering up to 4x faster throughput with native 4,000Hz hyper-polling and 4,000Hz key scanning, while simultaneously driving up to 20-layer lighting effects.
A programmable iCUE control wheel gives you command over backlighting, media jogging, and more through CORSAIR iCUE software, customizable to perform actions in games and applications.
body.description: The incomparable CORSAIR K100 RGB Optical-Mechanical Gaming Keyboard combines stunning aluminum design with per-key RGB lighting and a 44-zone LightEdge. Powerful CORSAIR AXON Hyper-Processing Technology enables unparalleled capabilities such as 4,000Hz polling. CORSAIR OPX RGB optical-mechanical keyswitches. offer hyper-fast 1.0mm actuation while registering keypresses up to 4x faster than standard mechanical gaming keyboards thanks to AXON, housed in durable double-shot PBT keycaps.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: The K100 RGB’s refined design features a durable aluminum frame and dynamic per-key RGB backlighting accented by a 44-zone three-sided RGB LightEdge.

POWERED BY AXON CORSAIR AXON Hyper-Processing Technology enables CORSAIR'S most advanced gaming keyboard experience by delivering your inputs up to 4x faster with native 4,000Hz hyper-polling and 4,000Hz key scanning, while simultaneously driving 20-layer lighting effects.

MACRO CONTROL Gain an in-game advantage with six dedicated macro keys, fully programmable for complex macros and key remaps in iCUE software, or program special streaming commands through Elgato Stream Deck software.
LINEAR & HYPER FAST Exclusive CORSAIR OPX optical-mechanical keyswitches offer hyper-fast input with just 1.0mm actuation distance and smooth linear travel for top-tier gaming performance.

Previous page Take command over backlighting, media jogging, and more with a multi-function iCUE control wheel. Next page 1 BRIGHTNESS 2 SWITCH APPLICATION 3 ZOOM 4 TRACK JOGGING & SELECT 5 CUSTOM MODES

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth it if it is what you want
reviews.reviewText: What I mean by the title is that this keyboard is for a specific group of people. Off the bat, this thing is EXPENSIVE! It is the priciest keyboard I saw when browsing, but given my preferences and my love for Corsair, I had to have it. It is also a laptop style keyboard, or that is to say that it use Ultra Low Profile (ULP) Tactile Switches from Cherry. The keys are thin, and have a very low actuation distance. It's wireless via dongle or Bluetooth, and comes with a very nice black USB-C cable. It is thin, sleek, and beautiful in my opinion. I love the way the keys feel, look, and type. Overall it is the best keyboard on the market for me, and the one I use. I just think it could have done a couple of things differently, or even had an upgraded model(read further).Looks-wise, this is it. The thickest part of this keyboard is smaller than the thinnest part of my previous k70 LUX. I took a few moments to revel in that upon unboxing. The RGB is gorgeous, but doesn't have what I have come to see as 'obnoxious' backlighting. The font of the keys is so much better than my k70. These have a professional look to them, and even with the RGB it doesn't scream 'gamer!', even though it may satiate that look to those looking for it. It matches my full RGB PC 'gamer' setup very well. The brushed aluminum is gorgeous. They fumbled not using it for the keycaps as well. For the price? Come on. It would have an even more impressive shine and it would have such a luxurious feel, possibly staying colder and reducing sweat while improving grip(Corsair I would love to work on your design team ;). Other reviewers were talking about making the bottom metal as well. I don't really care with that. The screen is beautiful, but why can't I change the status LED colors, only the logo. Almost three hundred dollars. Small miss but these are the things you look for when you buy this type of keyboard. The brightness settings look good as well.It was easy to use and set up, but might be because I am very familiar with iCUE. Assuming this would be your only slipstream device and you download iCUE prior to plugging the keyboard in, setting it up would probably be pretty easy for anyone. The wireless dongle works very well as long as it is plugged in to a USB 3.0 port or better. Wired mode works great of course.I personally love the iCUE software. I love Corsair and I think iCUE is rightfully considered at the forefront of proprietary RGB tech. The keyboard was easy to set up and integrate, and it works so well. The keyboard has tons of profile slots for wired profiles and 2 for hardware slots. Some people seem to think that only the hardware profiles work in wireless mode. This is not true. You just have to set another lighting layer in your profile for wireless mode, which is only available to be edited in wireless mode. Vice Versa with wired mode editing. This is the only quirk I have encountered to date. Wired switches instantly with the profile button but wireless takes 2-3 seconds. Not ideal but I can live with it. Overall I love iCUE and it works well with the K100 Air.Now, my qualms and an idea. This keyboard is so thin. I said that as a positive earlier, and it is, but after a while of using this on my desk, it became a negative sometimes. Not to say I dislike the actual key and switch size, but the keyboard occasionally comes across as too low to the surface. Like I got a 3/4in book and set the keyboard on there and I liked how it felt a lot. It would be cool if Corsair could make, or include(price, again) some sort of mount you can sit the keyboard on to raise it up. Second, Corsair blew an opportunity not including Nexus into the screen on this keyboard. I'm gonna be mad when it comes out for the next generation right after I buy this one, but I digress. The screen on this one is cool and looks good, but the plastic cover is awful and being unable to change the indicator light colors is just bad.Corsair should have either incorporated Nexus into this keyboard, or had the option for a "K100 Air Pro" with the Nexus for slightly more.Overall, I love this keyboard. It fits my style. The reason I said to buy it if it is what you want, is because this keyboard won't appeal to the type of person who likes a thick mechanical keyboard, blaring RGB, and their clicks as loud as possible. This is more lowkey and function oriented for typing. The ULP switches are slightly but noticeably quieter than the Cherry MX Red's I had on the K70 LUX. The RGB does not light up my desk like the K70. This is a very subjective pro. It is so thin. Subjectively a pro and a con at times. ULP switches are another subjective pro. What I am getting at is that except for the couple grievances I had, I love this keyboard. This keyboard performs how it set out to. It is up to you to figure out if that is what you want. It IS what I want, and I appreciate how well it achieves that. Overall a 5/5 for me, and Corsair, I always have more product and design ideas.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My favorite keyboard of all time?
reviews.reviewText: I do a lot of typing for my job, so I don't mind spending a little on keyboards for the quality of life improvements they bring, but I've found it surprisingly hard to find keyboards that I really love. In the past I've looked for keyboards with backlit keys, which makes it easy to spot keys at a glance, and Cherry MX switches because of the more satisfying tactile feedback they give. But even among those higher end keyboards there were always little things that bugged me. Up until very recently, for example, I used a Corsair K95 keyboard. Great key visibility in all lighting and excellent macro capabilities, but the sensitivity of the keys was too high for me. I'd constantly find myself accidentally brushing a macro key or typing double keys because I pressed a millisecond too long, but I put up with it because it was kind of the best I could find with the features I was looking for. But then last week I was careless and knocked over a can of sparkling water and it zapped my K95 so I hopped on Amazon and bought what I initially thought was the same keyboard. When it arrived however, I discovered it was actually a newer keyboard in their line, the K100.I plugged it in and started typing a couple of paragraphs of stream of consciousness just to get a feel for it and almost immediately realized something major had changed in the new version. The keys have the same great visibility from the backlight, the same or maybe even slightly better tactile feedback with the new OPX optical switches, but the sensitivity is tuned to almost exactly what I would consider optimal. Responsive to every intentional keypress but forgiving of accidental brushes. I freaking love it. I love it so much I just bought it again to keep as a backup for the next time I act like an idiot and forget the no drinks on the desk rule.Keyboards are surprisingly personal to people, some people have found ways to keep using keyboards manufactured 40 years ago because they can't stand the feel of more modern designs, so I can't guarantee you'll love what I love about this keyboard. But I can tell you the feel of typing on it is buttery smooth, the aluminum case is solid feeling and stiff, the sound and tactile feedback of keypresses is very satisfying, and it seems to all be calibrated to be sensitive but not too sensitive. If you have the budget, I'd highly recommend giving it a try.

por las características de conexión (SLIPSTREAM, Bluetooth, USB) es un excelente teclado, las dimensiones son extremadamente extraordinarias, muy bonito diseño, la respuesta de pulsación es buena, es un lujo tener este tecladoSi lo adquieres debes de tener en cuenta que el botón de volumen en conexiones inalámbricas esta desactivado y se tiene que programar mediante icue.

Não tem como errar na escolha desse teclado, comprei e compraria denovo.Corsair é Corsair, a linha gamers dele é fantástica e durável.Eu já fui cliente da Razer e Logitech G, mas tudo quebra mto rápido, mesmo cuidando bem (e olha que não sou gamer hardcore nem nada).A verdade eh que essas linhas gamer são feitas pra quebrar em médio/longo prazo, obsolescência programada, né? Mas os equipamentos da Corsair duram bastante e não pretendo sair deles tão cedo!

Jamas crei invertir tanto tiempo en un teclado por lo bueno que es. Los materiales son muy buenos y el tiempo de respuesta es excelente. Sumado a su uso y decoracion con ICue literalmente es de los mejores teclados que he usado. Solo ten en cuenta que las teclas son hipersensibles, y te tomara un poco de tiempo adaptarte a escribir bien sin equivocarte o meter letras incorrectas, ademas de que el polvo se nota bastante al acumularse, pero de ahi en mas, todo esta perfecto. 10/10.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you are a gamer or a serious power user this is the keyboard for you!!!
reviews.reviewText: If you are a gamer or a serious power user such a photo editor or someone that spends alot of time on the computer, then this is the keyboard for you.To start with, this keyboard is pricey however it is well worth it.The over all build quality is amazing.... the keyboard is very well build and is solid. The optical switches are super fast and easy to press, however will take a little time to get use to as you do not have to press hardly at all before they registar the key stroke.The RGB blights are very bright a crystal clear... however they are not to bight or distracting.The ICUE softwear is the best program for a keyboard that I have used to date and I have used alot of programs that have come with keyboards to program the extra keys. It will take a few minutes to figure out however, once you do you will have your extra prorgramable "G" keys set up to your liken for marcos or to open programs that you use the most.Over all I love the build quality of the keyboard in general, but i love how soild they keys are and how easy they are to press. Your fingers will like it to at the end of the day if you do alot of gaming or typing.I Highly suggest this keyboard... it will last a very long time.Lastly, there is a USB pass through port on the front of the keyboard for extra device to plug in such as game pad, head phone, webcam or ect.the ICUE wheel control is amazing detail also that lets you do verious things as well.10 out of 10 rating on this soild and amazing keyboards.

reviews.reviewTitle: Todo excelente Calidad del producto es premium
reviews.reviewText: El producto llego perfectamente bien y en optimas condiciones sin ningún tipo de detalle y con la caja completamente sellada. En cuanto a la calidad del producto este tiene una calidad premium en cada detalle del teclado, sin duda es la mejor compra. (LO MAS IMPORTANTE Y MUY INTERESANTE ES QUE A PESAR DE QUE NO TIENE LA TECLA “Ñ” EN CUANTO CONECTE EL TECLADO A MI PC SE CONFIGURO AL ESPAÑOL EN AUTOMATICO Y NO TENGO QUE OPRIMIR NINGUN COMANDO PASA SACAR ESTA LETRA YA QUE SOLO CON PRECIONAR EL BOTON DONDE DEBERIA DE ESTAR ESTA TECLA APARECE SIN NINGUN PROBLEMA)
